title: Meyerhoff manifold
summary: In hyperbolic geometry, the Meyerhoff manifold is the arithmetic hyperbolic 3-manifold obtained by ( 5 , 1 ) {\displaystyle (5,1)} surgery on the figure-8 knot complement.  It was introduced by Robert MeyerhoffÂ (1987) as a possible candidate for the hyperbolic 3-manifold of smallest volume, but the Weeks manifold turned out to have  slightly smaller volume. It has  the second smallest volume
